text: saturday afternoon at 230 with a posted opening time of 2 pm  several cars came and went and doors are locked  no way to run a business
those who are stingy can get internet for just 10
the food was acceptable but it was too expensive in my opinion
the new sushi rolls which include the mango roll cali roll and tuna roll are all very tasty furthermore the crab cream cheese wontons are incredibly tasty and i thoroughly enjoy the pad thai
the ambiance was superb the food was incredible and the service was impeccable
it was a glorious sight when i went to that place in march and saw that they had homemade strawberry rhubarb jam at all the tables i almost peed myself thinking about it

this little gem serves some amazing lamb saag and butter masala while it may take a bit of time to get there its definitely worth the wait i havent had the opportunity to visit during the lunch buffet yet
the boba tea served here is unmatched by any other place in the valley

my food was really good my only complaint was the rude waitress who was very angry when i asked if i could eat there only because she had already boxed it up without asking me if it was to take away or eat in not a huge deal but disheartening for a weary tourist tired from hours of walking

i have tried everything and it was all good even the broccoli my wife had salmon today and we are quite particular about fish this dish passed the test and was enjoyable my friend loves black and blue coleslaw and i wish there were more outgoing staff members but they are all kind and helpful

my goto stop on the way home from work is burger king but im always disappointed because my order is usually wrong and i have to wait a long time for my food at the drivethru i feel like its one of gods cruel jokes

despite the impressive service and presentation at this restaurant which is named after gordon ramsey the food itself was not particularly flavorful however if youre in the mood for a hamburger and some sides youll need to be prepared to spend close to 40 per person without drinks

we had a terrible experience at the restaurant we arrived at 515 pm to find the restaurant completely empty and when we tried to enter we were rudely turned away because we didnt have a reservation we saw another group being seated but they got up and left before we even had a chance to be seated

we decided to visit the only late night place at the wynn because it was the only option available to us at the time although the service was slow the food was good but not particularly impressive i believe that it may be more beneficial to look for late night dining options outside of the wynn in the future as i find it to be overpriced and not particularly worth it however the food itself tasted good
visiting pinks in hollywood is one of my favorite things but i wasnt satisfied with the hot dog i got there it was cold and didnt taste very good
i am thoroughly enjoying the new sushi rolls which include the mango roll the cali roll and the tuna roll furthermore the crab cream cheese wontons are a delicious snack and i love the pad thai

the only late night dining spot we found at the wynn where we stayed was not exceptional in terms of service or food quality although the food was good i believe it is not worth the cost and that there are better options available outside of the wynn however i must admit that the food did taste good
if youre looking for a quick and convenient meal thailana on indian school is a good choice however if youre looking for exceptional thai food it might not be the best option

upon arrival at the restaurant at 515 we discovered that it was empty but the staff were rude to us and refused to seat us without a reservation we observed another group being seated and then leaving the restaurant
this spot is renowned for providing the most delectable boba tea in the valley

the brisket was amazing with just enough fat to melt in your mouth and a flavor that was better than most brisket ive had the creamed corn was so good that i could easily finish an entire tub of it i wish i didnt have to travel all the way to los angeles but i will definitely return
not at all not in any way

the ambiance food and beer at this restaurant are always topnotch however the service is consistently subpar and its not just this visit  its been the same for all four visits ive made here in the past year

everything i have tried has been good even the broccoli  my wife had the salmon today we are kind of snobs when it comes to fish and this passed the test  my friend loves the black and blue coleslaw  nni wish there were some bigger personalities on the staff but they are all nice and helpful
more like pooptine they were out of everything sad face there is a fleur de lis on the door though so that was ok
solid tacos i love coming here on taco tuesday for taco deals  great hard beef tacos for cheap

the food at this restaurant was not as flavorful as one would expect from its famous chef gordon ramsey however the service and presentation were excellent and the hamburgers and sides were definitely worth the price which was close to 40 per person without drinks
